headline.main: Nelson Sees Industrial Decks Cleared for Capacity Output; Pearl Harbor Attack Opened New Phase in Our Planning, With Civilian Needs Giving Way to All-Out War Production NELSON REVIEWS 1ST YEAR OF WAR

lead_paragraph: During the first year of the war the United States got the bulk of its tremendous industrial facilities on an all-out basis. There are still formidable problems to solve but by and large our industrial decks are cleared for a year of capacity war production.
snippet: During the first year of the war the United States got the bulk of its tremendous industrial facilities on an all-out basis. There are still formidable problems to solve but by and large our industrial decks are cleared for a year of capacity war ...

byline.original: By DONALD M. NELSON Chairman, War Production Board
